meanings.definition: To inform against; denounce or accuse.
meanings.sent1: I will delate my friend for stealing my toy.
meanings.sent2: She decided to delate her coworker for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent3: The cat will delate the dog for making a mess in the house.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to delate the student for cheating on the test.
meanings.sent5: The witness will delate the suspect in court tomorrow.

meanings.definition: To carry or bring forward as an accusation.
meanings.sent1: He will delate the evidence to prove his case.
meanings.sent2: The prosecutor will delate the new information in court.
meanings.sent3: The detective will delate the suspect's alibi during the interrogation.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer had to delate the key witness to strengthen the case.
meanings.sent5: The student will delate the cheating incident to the principal.
